poem:
Title: Verbal Tombstones in the City

Oh, London, cocoon of tongue and tension,
Walls echoing with sharp dissonance.
An ugly cacophony, heedlessly sown,
Seed to the wind, futures unknown.
Fear and faith, intertwined, begin their dance;
The city, a stage for their dreadful performance.
Suffer not hatred, for it fares no sound,
Forgiveness and acceptance, the holy ground.
